sen.j: 柳谷登山鉄道（やなぎだにとざんてつどう）は、現在の長岡京市の柳谷観音（楊谷寺）付近に設置が計画されたケーブルカーである。
sen.e: Yanagidani Mountain Railway (Yanagidani Tozan Tetsudo) was a funicular railway intended to be installed near Yanagidani Kannon (Yokoku-ji Temple) in today's Nagaokakyo City.
Yanagidani Mountain Railway ("Yanagidani Tozan Tetsudo" in Japanese) was a cable car line, which was intended to run near Yanagidani Kannon (Yokoku-ji Temple) in the present day Nagaokakyo City.
Yanagidani Mountain Railway ("Yanagidani Tozan Tetsudo" in Japanese) was a cable car line, which was intended to run near Yanagidani Kannon (Yokoku-ji Temple) in the present day Nagaokakyo City.

tit.e: Railway data (at the time of planning)

sen.j: 路線距離：金原寺付近 - 旧海印寺村浄土谷付近 0.7km
sen.e: Railway distance: 0.7 km from Kongen-ji Temple area to Jododani, former Kaiinji-mura area.
sen.cmt: 海印寺浄土谷村はVillageと明記すべきかもしれませんが、用語集の用語検索で「海印寺村浄土谷 Jododani, Kaiinji-mura 鉄道」とありましたのでこのように訳しています。
sen.e: Railway distance: 0.7 km from the vicinity of Kongen-ji Temple to the vicinity of Jododani, former Kaiinji-mura.
Railway distance: 0.7 km from the vicinity of Kongen-ji Temple to the vicinity of Jododani, former Kaiinji-mura.
Track gauge: 1,067 mm
Track gauge: 1,067 mm
Track gauge: 1,067 mm

sen.j: 新京阪鉄道柳谷観音延長線（長岡天神駅 - 柳谷観音・未成）
sen.e: The Yanagidani-kannon Extended Line, Shinkeihan Railway (Nagaoka Tenjin station to the uncompleted Yanagidani Kannon)
The Shinkeihan Railway Yanagidani-Kannon Extended Line (extending from Nagaoka Tenjin station to the Yanagidani Kannon; uncompleted)
The Shinkeihan Railway Yanagidani-Kannon Extended Line (extending from Nagaoka Tenjin station to the Yanagidani Kannon; uncompleted)

sen.j: なお、この路線とは別に、向日町駅 - 楊谷寺間に同じような路線が計画され、長法寺校前には測量杭がずっと打ってあったという。
sen.e: It is said that there was a plan to open a similar line between Mukomachi Station and Yokoku-ji Temple in addition to this route, and stakes for the survey were pegged in front of Choho-ji School.
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語検索で「長法寺校 School of Chojo-ji Temple 鉄道」が見つかりましたが、"Choho-ji"が正しいと思われます。 http://www.shichouson.com/kyoto/nagaokakyoshi-chouhouji.html また地名としての長法寺校なので寺を明示的に訳出する必要はないと考えChoho-ji Schoolとしました。
sen.e: There were plans to open an additional line between Mukomachi Station and Yokoku-ji Temple, and surveying stakes remained pegged to the ground in front of Choho-ji School for a long while.
There were plans to open an additional line between Mukomachi Station and Yokoku-ji Temple, and surveying stakes remained pegged to the ground in front of Choho-ji School for a long while.

sen.j: また、楊谷寺の阿弥陀堂には、柳谷参道電灯線路工事有志連名の奉納額が現在も残されている。
sen.e: Also an Amida-do Hall (a temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha) in Yokoku-ji Temple still has a frame donated by Lighting Railway Construction workers of Yanagidani Approach.

There still remains a votive tablet in the Amida-do Hall (a temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha) of Yokoku-ji Temple offered by the railway lighting construction workers of Yanagidani Walk.

There still remains a votive tablet in the Amida-do Hall (a temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha) of Yokoku-ji Temple offered by the railway lighting construction workers of Yanagidani Walk.

sen.j: 大正初期頃 会社設立
sen.e: The company was established around the Taisho period.
Beginning of the Taisho period - Company is founded.
Beginning of the Taisho period - Company is founded.

sen.j: 1922年（大正11年）12月20日 鉄道敷設免許取得
sen.e: On December 20, 1922 the company received a railway construction license.
December 20, 1922 - Company obtains a railway construction license.
December 20, 1922 - Company obtains a railway construction license.

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年） 井上英次郎が取締役社長に就く
sen.e: In 1924 Eijiro INOUE assumed the position of president.
1924 - Eijiro INOUE assumes the position of president.
1924 - Eijiro INOUE assumes the position of president.

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）7月 楊谷寺の住職が発起人総代を退任
sen.e: In July, 1924 the chief priest of Yokoku-ji Temple resigned as the promoters' representative.
July, 1924 - Chief priest of Yokoku-ji Temple resigns as promoters' representative.
July, 1924 - Chief priest of Yokoku-ji Temple resigns as promoters' representative.

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）8月 路線の測量許可を申請
sen.e: On August, 1924 the company applied for the route survey license.
August, 1924 - Company applies for route survey license.
August, 1924 - Company applies for route survey license.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）5月21日 免許失効
sen.e: On 21May, 1935 the license lapsed.
May 21, 1935 - Railway construction license lapses.
May 21, 1935 - Railway construction license lapses.
